page.title: Domestic responses to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

Line 236: Line 236:
* Amendment of Article 179: Amendments in 2007 to Article 179 included an "anti-terrorism" measure, which allows for arbitrary arrest, searches and wiretapping without warrant, and transfer of any civilian court case of the presidentâs choosing to military tribunals. Unlike the Emergency law, it is a permanent measure and not a temporary measure requiring parliamentary approval.
* Amendment of Article 179: Amendments in 2007 to Article 179 included an "anti-terrorism" measure, which allows for arbitrary arrest, searches and wiretapping without warrant, and transfer of any civilian court case of the presidentâs choosing to military tribunals. Unlike the Emergency law, it is a permanent measure and not a temporary measure requiring parliamentary approval.

In the Spring 2010, Mohamed El baradei began circulating a petition in the runup to the [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010]] calling for 7 specific reforms:
+
In the Spring 2010, Mohamed El baradei began circulating a petition in the runup to the [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010]] calling for [[National_Association_for_Change#Platform|7 specific reforms]]:
# End the state of emergency.
# End the state of emergency.
# Ensure full judicial supervision of elections.
# Ensure full judicial supervision of elections.
Line 244: Line 244:
# Work toward a political system built on democracy and social justice.
# Work toward a political system built on democracy and social justice.
# Provide the right to nomination for political office without obstacles, in accordance with Egyptâs obligations under the International Convention on Civil and Political Rights; limit the president to two terms.
# Provide the right to nomination for political office without obstacles, in accordance with Egyptâs obligations under the International Convention on Civil and Political Rights; limit the president to two terms.

# Allow voting by national identification card. These measures will require amending articles 76, 77, and 88 of the Constitution as soon as possible.<ref name="egyptelections">{{cite web|first=Matthew|url=http://egyptelections.carnegieendowment.org/2010/09/01/constitutional-and-legal-framework|title=Constitutional and Legal Framework|work=[[Carnegie Endowment]] |location=Washington, D.C.|accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref>
